text: Maiwand Teaching Hospital is a hospital in Kabul built in the 1960s. When first built it was called Qale-e-Baqer Khan Hospital, later the name was changed to Mastorat. It was given its present name during the Democratic Republic of Afghanistan. It is closely linked with Kabul Medical University. It has departments of otorhinolaryngology, dermatology, pediatrics, Plastic Surgery and Pediatric Surgery. ==See also== *List of hospitals in Afghanistan ==References== Category:Hospitals in Kabul Category:Teaching hospitals in Afghanistan
title: Maiwand Teaching Hospital
